channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Lung Cancer Awareness Month
item.description:
Sunday, November 5, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Green to support Lung Cancer Awareness Month.

November marks Lung Cancer Awareness month and we are raising awareness for the need of more lung cancer nurses, increased research funding and faster access to treatment. Lung cancer is Australia's biggest cancer killer, with one Australian dying from the disease every hour. We are shining a light on lung cancer to raise funds to change the lung cancer space for the better, and on Saturday 4th November, we will be holding our community walk that evening in South Bank.

This Light Up is organised by: Lung Foundation Australia

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Colour the World Orange Day
item.description:
Monday, November 6, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Orange to support Colour the World Orange Day.

Color the World Orange Day allows everyone touched by CRPS (Complex Regional Pain Syndrome) to join together to spread global awareness of this poorly understood condition. Orange is the colour of our awareness ribbon, and while November is CRPS Awareness month, the first Monday in November has been selected as our CTWO day.

This Light Up is organised by: The Purple Bucket Foundation

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust's Annual Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Thursday, November 9, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support the Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust's Annual Christmas Appeal.

For more than 60 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grant where charities apply for toys, Foodbank food vouchers or to host a client Christmas party.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Queensland Brain Institute's 20th Anniversary
item.description:
Thursday, November 9, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support Queensland Brain Institute's 20th Anniversary.

2023 marks the Queensland Brain Institute's 20th Anniversary. Brain diseases and disorders change who a person is, generating far-reaching effects not just on those living with these conditions, but on family members and friends. Today, brain disorders, diseases, and injury account for over 20 per cent of the burden of disease in Australia. QBI researchers are working to solve these major health issues.

This Light Up is organised by: UQ Queensland Brain Institute

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Eve of Remembrance Day
item.description:
Friday, November 10, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to commemorate the Eve of Remembrance Day.

Remember to remember.

This Remembrance Day, join the world in honouring those who gave their lives in service. 
Saturday 11 November 2023 marks the anniversary of the Armistice that ended fighting with Germany in World War I. 

Every year at the 11th hour of the 11th day of the 11th month, millions around the globe pause in silence to remember the sacrifices many have made so we can enjoy life today.

This Light Up is organised by: Returned Services League of Australia (Qld Branch)

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Remembrance Day
item.description:
Saturday, November 11, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to commemorate the Remembrance Day.

Remember to remember.

This Remembrance Day, join the world in honouring those who gave their lives in service. 
Saturday 11 November 2023 marks the anniversary of the Armistice that ended fighting with Germany in World War I. 

Every year at the 11th hour of the 11th day of the 11th month, millions around the globe pause in silence to remember the sacrifices many have made so we can enjoy life today.

This Light Up is organised by: Returned Services League of Australia (Qld Branch)

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Cervical Cancer Awareness Week
item.description:
Sunday, November 12, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Orange to support Cervical Cancer Awareness Week.

The Australian Cervical Cancer Foundation (ACCF) works in Australia and in developing countries (using its Overseas Relief Fund) to enhance and protect women’s health. ACCF programs help to eliminate cervical cancer through vaccination and screening and also the development of Awareness, Education and Support programs for cervical cancer and its prevention. National Cervical Cancer Awareness Week aims to raise awareness about cervical cancer and encourage Australians to engage in the conversation about cervical health.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Cervical Cancer Foundation

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of World Pancreatic Cancer Awareness Day
item.description:
Wednesday, November 15, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support the Eve of World Pancreatic Cancer Awareness Day.

November 16th is World Pancreatic Cancer Awareness Day. Pancreatic cancer is currently responsible for the 3rd highest amount of cancer deaths, and thus is an extremely deadly cancer in Australia. On this day, we are asking venues across the globe to turn purple to honour those lost to pancreatic cancer or currently fighting, as well as raise important awareness for this disease. With only a 12.5% chance of survival beyond 5 years.

This Light Up is organised by: Pankind Australian Pancreatic Cancer Foundation Limited

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of National Ag Day
item.description:
Thursday, November 16, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green to support the Eve of National Ag Day.

AgForce is a peak organisation representing Queensland's rural producers. We exist to ensure the long-term growth, viability, competitiveness and profitability of broadacre industries of cattle, grain, cane, sheep and wool in Queensland. Raise awareness and celebrate National Agriculture Day 2023.

This Light Up is organised by: AgForce Queensland Farmers Ltd

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: World Sanfilippo Awareness Day
item.description:
Thursday, November 16, 2023

City Hall will be lit Purple to support World Sanfilippo Awareness Day.

The purpose of the Sanfilippo Children's Foundation is to drive research for a world without Sanfilippo syndrome, a rare yet devastating disease that leads to childhood dementia. The 16th of November marks World Sanfilippo Awareness Day, a day to spread global awareness of Sanfilippo syndrome, to honour children around the world living with Sanfilippo today, and also those we have lost to this heartbreaking disease. It also honours the families of these precious children.

This Light Up is organised by: The Sanfilippo Children's Foundation

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: World Prematurity Day
item.description:
Friday, November 17, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support World Prematurity Day.

World Prematurity Day is celebrated on 17 November each year to raise awareness of the nearly 15 million babies born premature each year. Worldwide and the nearly 1 million who lose their fight for life. Landmarks around the World are lit up purple on this Day to raise awareness of the plight of babies born premature and to honour the struggles of these babies to survive and thrive. It also raises awareness of parent groups like PIPA.

This Light Up is organised by: PIPA

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

Worldwide and the nearly 1 million who lose their fight for life. Landmarks around the World are lit up purple on this Day to raise awareness of the plight of babies born premature and to honour the struggles of these babies to survive and thrive. It also raises awareness of parent groups like PIPA.
This Light Up is organised by: PIPA

item.title: Latvian Independence Day
item.description:
Saturday, November 18, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red and White to celebrate Latvian Independence Day.

The Brisbane Latvian Association wishes to celebrate this significant date in Latvia's history - becoming a republic in 1918 on the 18th November. This year marks 105 years of independence.

This is one of many significant dates in the Latvian culture that is celebrated by the Brisbane Latvian Association, who also provide workshops to the wider community so that the traditions are not lost. Latvians have contributed to the Queensland Community whilst maintaining links to their heritage.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Latvian Association

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Youngcare Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Saturday, November 18, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to support the Youngcare Christmas Appeal.

Times are tough. But times are tougher for young people with disabilities. The Youngcare Christmas appeal is raising awareness and funds to achieve its mission, particularly in the lead up to the International Day of Disabled Persons on 3rd of December.

Youngcare is a national not-for-profit, revolutionising the way young people with high care disability live. We are creating a more inclusive Australia by empowering industry, government and community to work together and challenge the way society views disability. We develop aspirational Specialist Disability Accommodation (SDA), advocate for much-needed policy change, deliver vital grants programs, and provide education, advice and pathways through our free support service.

This Light Up is organised by: Youngcare  Ltd

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust's Annual Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Sunday, November 19, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support the Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust's Annual Christmas Appeal.

For more than 60 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grant where charities apply for toys, Foodbank food vouchers or to host a client Christmas party.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Transgender Day of Remembrance
item.description:
Monday, November 20, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue Pink and White to support Transgender Day of Remembrance.

Many Genders One Voice holds a Transgender Day of Remembrance ceremony every year, as part of other international events that occur during Transgender Awareness Week. This week aims to help raise the visibility of transgender, gender diverse and non-binary people, and address the issues the community faces. The final day of Transgender Awareness Week is Transgender Day of Remembrance (TDOR), an annual observance on November 20 that honours the memory of those whose lives were lost in acts of anti-transgender violence.

This Light Up is organised by: Many Genders One Voice and Queensland AIDS Council

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.description:
Tuesday, November 21, 2023

City Hall will be lit Green to celebrate the Greg Norman Medal Dinner.

The Greg Norman Medal, Australian golf’s most prestigious award, will be awarded at a Gala Dinner held at City Hall.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Zonta Says No to Violence Against Women
item.description:
Tuesday, November 21, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Orange to support Zonta Says No to Violence Against Women.

The Zonta Club of Brisbane East Inc, a member of Zonta International, raises funds annually to support local projects towards a common goal – to improve the legal, educational, economic, political and health status of women. The Club is not for profit, run by volunteers and all funds raised are directed to projects, such as educational scholarships for women, support to women refuges and support services such as Brisbane Domestic Violence Service. Annually the Zonta Clubs of Brisbane conduct a campaign, under the Banner Zonta Says No to Violence against Women, to raise awareness of domestic and family violence in the community and to support women and their children when they find themselves in such a situation.

This Light Up is organised by: Zonta Club of Brisbane East Inc

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

Annually the Zonta Clubs of Brisbane conduct a campaign, under the Banner Zonta Says No to Violence against Women, to raise awareness of domestic and family violence in the community and to support women and their children when they find themselves in such a situation.

This Light Up is organised by: Zonta Club of Brisbane East Inc

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: National Asbestos Awareness Week
item.description:
Thursday, November 23, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support National Asbestos Awareness Week.

National Asbestos Awareness Week is held from Monday 20/11/23 to Sunday 26/11/23 to raise awareness about asbestos related diseases, to remember the many thousands of people who have died as a result of an asbestos related diseases and to encourage Australians to protect themselves against exposure to asbestos-containing materials, particularly when doing home renovations.

This Light Up is organised by: Asbestos Disease Support Society Limited

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Australian PGA Championships - Jarrod Lyle Day
item.description:
Friday, November 24, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Yellow to support Australian PGA Championships - Jarrod Lyle Day.

On 24th November, the Australian PGA Championship will be helping to raise much-needed funds for Challenge, a charity devoted to supporting children and families living with cancer. Professionals and all involved in the tournament will be #DoingItForJarrod and wearing yellow in memory of Jarrod Lyle, an ambassador for Challenge and the ongoing dedication of this charity.  #DoingitforJarrod

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Australian PGA Championships
item.description:
Saturday, November 25, 2023

City Hall will be lit Blue to celebrate the Australian PGA Championships.

The Australian PGA Championship is the PGA's flagship event. One of the feature events on the ISPS HANDA PGA Tour of Australasia, the time-honoured tournament will be played in Brisbane. Some of the world's best golfers are expected to converge on the event to complete for the Joe Kirkwood Cup - Australian professional golf's oldest trophy.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust's Annual Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Sunday, November 26, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support the Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust's Annual Christmas Appeal.

For more than 60 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grant where charities apply for toys, Foodbank food vouchers or to host a client Christmas party.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grant where charities apply for toys, Foodbank food vouchers or to host a client Christmas party.
